job_details.Vacaturetitel:
Senior Data Engineer, WBAA @ ING Netherlands
Senior Data Engineer, WBAA @ ING Netherlands

How to succeed
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join us in Amsterdam. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing complex data pipelines to process transactional and other data. You will collaborate closely with data scientists and analysts in developing and maintaining data solutions and INGA's data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives.
       We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills. We hire people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time in Amsterdam. Come join us!
       A working day in the life of a Data Engineer
       A typical day for a data engineer starts with coffee, catching up with colleagues, and drafting a plan for the coming day. After the standup, you will start exploring the data to solve business problems, building and maintaining the production-ready infrastructure, and building the data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate data from disparate sources. Being an advocate for best practices in data engineering is important while working on such tasks.
       After lunch, you organized a knowledge-sharing session to explain data security, compliance, and privacy standards to the rest of the data engineering team. Finally, to wrap up the day, you collaborated with the data science and analysts' teams to develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning.
job_details.full_text:
Senior Data Engineer, WBAA @ ING Netherlands
Senior Data Engineer, WBAA @ ING Netherlands

How to succeed

We are looking for a Data Engineer to join us in Amsterdam. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing complex data pipelines to process transactional and other data. You will collaborate closely with data scientists and analysts in developing and maintaining data solutions and INGA's data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives.
       We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills. We hire people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time in Amsterdam. Come join us!
       A working day in the life of a Data Engineer
       A typical day for a data engineer starts with coffee, catching up with colleagues, and drafting a plan for the coming day. After the standup, you will start exploring the data to solve business problems, building and maintaining the production-ready infrastructure, and building the data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate data from disparate sources. Being an advocate for best practices in data engineering is important while working on such tasks.
       After lunch, you organized a knowledge-sharing session to explain data security, compliance, and privacy standards to the rest of the data engineering team. Finally, to wrap up the day, you collaborated with the data science and analysts' teams to develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning.

profile_classification.rationale: The role heavily emphasizes designing, building, and optimizing complex data pipelines, collaborating with data scientists on data solutions and architecture, and developing data models for machine learning. This aligns with the core responsibilities of an ML Engineer focused on data engineering and model productionization.

phrases.phrase: support the next generation of products and data initiatives
phrases.justification: This phrase indicates an understanding of how data engineering efforts contribute to broader business goals and future product development.
Directly states the need to apply data engineering skills to address challenges and needs within the business context.
Highlights the application of data engineering to support various business functions including ML, which requires understanding business objectives for these applications.

phrases.phrase: designing, building, and optimizing complex data pipelines
phrases.justification: This is a core definition of data engineering activities, focusing on the creation and improvement of data flow systems.
Describes the fundamental task of handling and preparing data for further use.

phrases.phrase: developing and maintaining data solutions and INGA's data architecture
phrases.justification: Encompasses the broader scope of data engineering, including the foundational architecture and the solutions built upon it.

phrases.phrase: building and maintaining the production-ready infrastructure
phrases.justification: Refers to the creation and upkeep of the systems that support data processing and pipelines in a live environment.

phrases.phrase: building the data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate data from disparate sources
phrases.justification: Details the specific steps involved in data engineering: cleaning, transforming, and combining data from various origins.
Indicates a focus on established methodologies and standards within the data engineering discipline.

phrases.phrase: develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning
phrases.justification: Connects data engineering tasks directly to the creation of pipelines and models that serve specific analytical and ML purposes.

phrases.phrase: collaborate closely with data scientists and analysts in developing and maintaining data solutions
phrases.justification: While not directly building models, this collaboration implies involvement in the data preparation and pipeline aspects that feed into model development.

phrases.phrase: develop data models and pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning
phrases.justification: Explicitly mentions the development of data models, which are foundational for machine learning and research.

phrases.phrase: building and maintaining the production-ready infrastructure
phrases.justification: This involves aspects of software engineering principles applied to data infrastructure to ensure it's robust and operational.

phrases.phrase: building and maintaining the production-ready infrastructure
phrases.justification: This phrase strongly suggests the operational aspects of ensuring data systems are live and functional, akin to MLOps for data pipelines.

phrases.phrase: data security, compliance, and privacy standards
phrases.justification: Knowledge and application of these standards are crucial for maintaining production systems and ensuring responsible data handling, a key part of operations.

soft_skills.skill: committed to developing themselves and learning new skills
collaborate closely with data scientists and analysts
